meanings.definition: By this or that time; previously.
meanings.sent1: I had finished my homework already.
meanings.sent2: She had already left when I arrived.
meanings.sent3: The cake was already eaten before the party started.
meanings.sent4: His reputation had already spread far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The sun had already set, painting the sky in beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: So soon; as soon as this.
meanings.sent1: He was already tired after just a few minutes of running.
meanings.sent2: The movie had already begun when we got to the theater.
meanings.sent3: The baby was already crying before the food arrived.
meanings.sent4: The news had already spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent5: The flowers had already withered despite being freshly picked.

meanings.sent1: I had already visited that museum years ago.
meanings.sent2: She had already graduated from college by the time I started.
meanings.sent3: The cat had already caught the mouse before I could intervene.
meanings.sent4: The story had already been told countless times in the village.
meanings.sent5: The tree had already grown tall when they planted it in the garden.
